Description: You can use the read interaction to look up a Practitioner resource by a constant server ID. The read interaction allows you to store only the server ID, and with a single request, retrieve the most up-to-date role information on a Practitioner. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship.

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether the practitioner's record is in active use.

communication.Name: communication
communication.Description: A language the practitioner is able to use in patient communication.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
The practitioner or user ID. Starting in February 2022, for external practitioners with a National Provider Identifier (NPI), this service returns an identifier type of NPI and the ID of the NPI. In May 2020 and later, for Epic provider-based or user-based practitioners, this service returns both the Epic provider ID and the Epic user ID associated with the practitioner when there is a link between the provider and user records. The Epic provider ID will be returned with identifier system urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.xxx.y.7.2.836982. The Epic user ID will be returned with the identifier system of urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.xxx.y.7.2.697780. The xxx value will be replaced with an organization-specific sub-identifier and the y value will change depending on whether the environment is Epic-owned, a non-production environment, or a production environment. In August 2020 and later, if the identifier is set to one of the following ID types and system OIDs, the corresponding system URL is returned in Identifier.system:
ID Type System OID System URL returned in Identifier.system
UZI 2.16.528.1.1007.3.1 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/uzi-nr-pers
AGB 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.6.1 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/agb-z
BIG 2.16.528.1.1007.5.1 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/big

name.Name: name
name.Description: The name of the practitioner, including all prefixes and suffixes available.

photo.Name: photo
photo.Description: Contains parameters related to the practitioner photo.

url.Name: url
url.Description: The URI or URL where the photo can be found. If this is a BLOB key, we will return a URL to a binary resource.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: Returned only for Epic user-based practitioners. Not returned in a MyChart context.

value.Name: value
value.Description: The email for the Epic user-based practitioner. Obtained from the user record.
